Dgame.Graphics.Spritesheet



class Spritesheet: Dgame.Graphics.Sprite.Sprite;
SpriteSheet extends Sprite and has, besides the texture, even a viewport and acts as a Texture Atlas. With slideViewport the viewport slides over the current row of the texture atlas. With setRow the current row can be changed (increased, decreased).

Author:
rschuett

this(Texture tex);
CTor

this(Texture tex, ref const FloatRect viewport);
CTor

this(Texture tex, const FloatRect viewport);
CTor

Rvalue version

final void setViewport(ref const FloatRect viewport);
Set or replace the current viewport. This Viewport is also set for the Texture.

final void setViewport(const FloatRect viewport);
Rvalue version

final const ref const(FloatRect) getViewport();
Get access to the current Viewport.

final inout inout(FloatRect)* fetchViewport();
Get mutable access to the current Viewport.

final const pure nothrow ubyte getRow();
Returns the current row (starting value is 0)

final void setRow(ubyte row);
Set a new row

void resetViewport();
Reset the Viewport.

void slideViewport();
Slide/move the current Viewport of the Texture. So the next area of the Texture atlas will be drawn.
